questions.question: How do I authenticate with the Sign Global API?
questions.summary: Use OAuth 2.0 client credentials, rotating secrets, and environment pinning for secure calls.
answer: Sign Global issues dedicated OAuth 2.0 client credentials per environment. Generate them from the developer console and scope them to the minimum capabilities required by your integration.
Exchange the client credentials for a short-lived bearer token using the /oauth/token endpoint. Tokens expire every 30 minutes, so cache and refresh them automatically within your integration.
When you promote to production, pin the issuing domain using the "aud" claim and enable mutual TLS if your compliance team requires it.
keyActions: Create sandbox credentials and store them securely using your secrets manager.
Automate token refresh at 70% of the token lifetime to avoid race conditions.
Enable mutual TLS and domain pinning before requesting production access.

questions.question: How can I verify webhook payloads?
questions.summary: Verify webhook signatures and replay protections to keep workflows tamper-proof.
answer: Every webhook payload includes an X-Signature header that combines an HMAC digest with an event timestamp.
Hash the raw request body with your webhook secret using SHA-256, then compare it to the provided signature using a constant-time comparison utility.
Reject payloads where the timestamp is older than five minutes or the nonce was previously processed to prevent replay attacks.
keyActions: Fetch the latest webhook secret from the console and rotate it quarterly.
Log rejected payloads with their message IDs for observability dashboards.
Leverage the retry headers to trace automatic replays after transient failures.

questions.question: Where is signer evidence stored and how can I localize it?
questions.summary: Select the residency region per workspace and archive signatures into your regulated storage.
answer: Every workspace defaults to the EU residency cluster. Workspace administrators can request additional regions from the compliance tab, including US, CA, and APAC.
For signature packets requiring on-prem archiving, stream finalized PDFs and audit logs to your S3-compatible vault using the data export API.
Residency preferences cascade to signer verification services, ensuring face match and identity checks stay in-region.
keyActions: Submit a residency change request from the console before going live in a new jurisdiction.
Configure export webhooks to push audit bundles to your cold storage bucket.
Review the residency status in quarterly compliance reviews.

questions.question: How do I export an immutable audit trail for regulators?
questions.summary: Bundle signer evidence, IP history, and biometric attestations into tamper-evident packages.
answer: Trigger an export by calling /evidence/export or by enabling automatic exports in the workspace trust settings.
Exports include the signed PDF, JSON audit log, signature certificates, and hash manifest. Store the manifest with your chain-of-custody evidence.
For regulated sectors, enable dual attestation to capture witness seals or qualified certificates within the same export bundle.
keyActions: Enable automatic exports after every completed envelope.
Validate manifest hashes in your downstream archive to detect tampering.
Route exports to SIEM tooling for anomaly alerting.

questions.question: How do I build conditional workflows with approvals and reminders?
questions.summary: Design multi-step flows with automated reminders and branch logic per recipient.
answer: Compose workflows in the visual builder or via the /workflows API by chaining steps for routing, approvals, and final signatures.
Add conditional branches that evaluate recipient metadata. For example, skip notarization when the contract value is below your internal threshold.
Configure reminder cadences per recipient role. Sign Global pauses reminders automatically once the envelope progresses to the next step.
keyActions: Model the workflow in the sandbox using sample recipients before pushing to production.
Centralize reminder templates to reuse copy across teams.
Audit workflow metrics weekly to tune reminder frequency.

questions.question: What is the best way to manage reminder fatigue?
questions.summary: Balance urgency with empathy using recipient-aware reminder cadences.
answer: Bundle reminder windows with event-based triggers so recipients receive nudges only when critical milestones slip.
Use the recipient engagement API to evaluate open and click activity. Reduce frequency automatically when engagement drops.
Escalate to backup recipients after a configurable number of remediations to keep SLAs intact.
keyActions: Segment reminder cadences by recipient persona and contract type.
Route stalled envelopes to customer success leaders before legal deadlines arrive.
Measure impact via the operations dashboard to prove time-to-signature improvements.
